theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic clocks as biomarkers and pacemakers of aging with emphasis on reversibility and modular epigenome models.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses DNA methylation clocks as aging biomarkers and their evolutionary conservation, fitting the epigenetic clock theme.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers epigenetic clocks as biomarkers and mediators of aging, including environmental modulation and developmental tuning.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes epigenetic clocks disrupted by environmental factors and links DNA damage to epigenetic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA methylation age as a biomarker and environmental acceleration of epigenetic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights epigenetic clock plasticity modulated by developmental environment and nutrient-sensing pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Meta-analysis of epigenetic age acceleration, genetic determinants, and causal mechanisms of epigenetic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Identifies latent DNA methylation signatures linked to aging and reprogramming, emphasizing reversible and irreversible components.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging as an epigenetic state reversible by reprogramming, linking epigenetic changes to aging clock reset.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA methylation changes, DNMT1 role, and epigenetic clocks as measures of biological age and rejuvenation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Introduces causality-enriched epigenetic clocks separating damaging and adaptive methylation changes influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Epigenetic Clock and Reprogramming Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models non-linear epigenetic aging trajectories and site-specific methylation rates, refining epigenetic clock understanding.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic dysregulation in stem cells affecting self-renewal, differentiation, and tissue regeneration during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes somatic epigenetic molecular clock reflecting stem cell divisions and niche dynamics influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links chromatin state changes and environmental remodeling to aging, emphasizing epigenetic memory and chromatin modifiers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes epigenetic regulation as a fundamental aging mechanism with environmental modulation and epigenetic stability decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details epigenetic alterations including histone modifications and DNA methylation drift as causal drivers of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers DNA methylation, histone modifications, ncRNAs, and nuclear architecture impacting epigenetic regulation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic drift, tissue-specific methylation changes, and DNA methylation machinery regulation during aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes interplay between DNA damage and epigenetic instability driving aging, with epigenetic clocks linked to DNA repair.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Epigenetic Aging and Dysregulation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details global hypomethylation and local hypermethylation affecting gene expression and genomic stability in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Remodeling and Nuclear Architecture Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chromatin modifier redistribution, DNA damage-induced chromatin remodeling, and nuclear architecture changes driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Remodeling and Nuclear Architecture Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes epigenetic regulation of FKBP5 and NF-κB inflammation feedback loop linking chromatin changes to cardiovascular aging risk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Remodeling and Nuclear Architecture Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows early life heat stress induces persistent histone acetylation and chromatin remodeling, establishing epigenetic memory.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Remodeling and Nuclear Architecture Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains transcriptional memory via dFOXO activation and chromatin remodeling that programs longevity through early-life epigenetic changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Remodeling and Nuclear Architecture Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links epigenetic alterations in SCN and hippocampus to circadian rhythm disruption and cognitive decline via chromatin changes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Remodeling and Nuclear Architecture Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-associated loss of epigenetic gene repression leading to aberrant gene activation and physiological dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Chromatin Remodeling and Nuclear Architecture Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes epigenetic hypomethylation of endogenous retroelements causing genomic instability and aging-related epigenetic dysregulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replication Timing and Mitotic Clock Epigenetic Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes DNA methylation loss in late-replicating domains as a mitotic clock tracking cell division history and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replication Timing and Mitotic Clock Epigenetic Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents a genetically regulated molecular clock concept with metabolic age as a proxy, linking molecular clock to aging variability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replication Timing and Mitotic Clock Epigenetic Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models epigenetic state changes non-linearly over time, analogous to molecular evolution clocks, capturing complex aging dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Thermodynamic and Information Theory of Epigenetic Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Frames DNA methylation as a thermodynamic and information processing system, linking entropy and energy dissipation to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Circadian Epigenetic Oscillation Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on circadian oscillations of cytosine modifications and their causal role in driving age-related epigenetic changes.
